sn31.4-12:3.1: 4–12 Nine Discourses On Givers of Fragrant Heartwood, etc.
sn31.4-12:4.2: Seated to one side, that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn31.4-12:4.3: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live in fragrant heartwood …
sn31.4-12:4.12: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does good things by way of body, speech, and mind.
sn31.4-12:4.14: ‘The gods of fairykind who live in fragrant heartwood … fragrant scents are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
sn31.4-12:4.16: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live in fragrant heartwood …
sn31.4-12:4.25: They give gifts of fragrant heartwood …
sn31.4-12:4.34: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live in fragrant scents.
sn31.4-12:4.35: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live on fragrant scents.”
